oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Development and operation of a perfusion bioreactor for the cultivation of mammalian cells inside a sponge-like ceramic matrix
Entwicklung und Betrieb eines Perfusions-Bioreaktors zur Kultivierung tierischer Zellen in einer keramischen Schwammstruktur
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Goralczyk, Vicky
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ddc:570
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cultivation of adherently growing cells inside three dimensional scaffolds gains more importance as speciÔ¨?c demands from medicine and industry arise. A huge challenge herein lies in nutrient supply all over the scaffold‚Äôs volume. This work presents a perfusion bioreactor device for cell cultivation inside porous aluminium oxide ceramics. The bioreactor supports vital growth of CHO-K1, A549, MDCK and human primary Ô¨?broblasts on and in ceramic cylinders of 5 mm height and 10 mm diameter with perfusion velocities from 0.33-0.66 ml min‚àí1 cm‚àí2. Proliferation was assured by a metabolic assay based on resazurin reduction and carbon content analysis. Cell distribution and vitality was assessed by staining cross sections of the ceramic. Fibrous structures were observed inside ceramic scaffolds for perfusion cultivation of CHO-K1 and human primary Ô¨?broblasts for several weeks by evaluation of scanning electron microscopy pictures. This clearly supports the hypothesis of micro milieu for- mation inside porous ceramics and consequently abundance of ECM-proteins. Perfusion therefore enables three-dimensional cell cultivation inside porous alumina ceramics.

Mit steigenden Anforderungen aus Medizin und industrieller WertstoÔ¨Äherstellung gewinnt die Kultivierung tierischer Zellen in dreidimensionalen Verb√ºnden zunehmend an Bedeutung.
